intro: Urtica longispica, commonly known as the long-stalked nettle, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Urticaceae family. It is characterized by its stinging hairs, which contain irritants that cause a skin reaction upon contact. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are heart-shaped with serrated edges and are covered in fine,茸毛-like structures. Urtica longispica produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters, which are wind-pollinated.
